sen.j: 大江町（おおえちょう）は、かつて京都府加佐郡におかれていた町。
sen.e: Oe-cho was a town located in Kasa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oe-cho was a town located in Kasa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Oe-cho was a town located in Kasa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）1月1日に天田郡三和町 (京都府)、夜久野町とともに福知山市に編入されて消滅した。
sen.e: On January 1, 2006, Oe-cho as well as Miwa-cho and Yakuno-cho in Amata-gun was absorbed by Fukuchiyama City, and the town was dissolved.
sen.cmt: 原文には、「三和町 (京都府)」 とありますが、「(京都府)」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「三和町」だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。
sen.e: On January 1, 2006, Oe-cho as well as Miwa-cho and Yakuno-cho in Amata-gun was absorbed by Fukuchiyama City, and the town was dissolved.
On January 1, 2006, Oe-cho as well as Miwa-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) and Yakuno-cho in Amata-gun was absorbed by Fukuchiyama City, and the town was dissolved.
sen.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: 大江山、由良川などの豊かな自然に恵まれ、また大江山の酒呑童子伝説を生かして「鬼の里」をアピールするユニークな町づくりを行っていた。
sen.e: The town had a wealth of nature such as the Oe-yama mountain range and the Yura-gawa River, and tried to build itslef uniquely by promoting itself as the 'Oni no Sato' (Village of an Ogre) based on the legend of Shuten-doji (an ogre) in the Oe-yama mountain range.

The town had a wealth of nature such as the Oe-yama mountain range and the Yura-gawa River, and tried to uniquely promoting itself as the 'Oni no Sato' (Village of an Ogre) based on the legend of Shuten-doji (an ogre) in the Oe-yama mountain range.

The town had a wealth of nature such as the Oe-yama mountain range and the Yura-gawa River, and tried to uniquely promote itself as the 'Oni no Sato' (Village of an Ogre) based on the legend of Shuten-doji (an ogre) in the Oe-yama mountain range.

sen.j: 北は舞鶴市と接し、東は綾部市、西は福知山市と接している。
sen.e: Oe-cho bordered Maizuru City to the north, Ayabe City to the east, and Fukuchiyama City to the west.
Oe-cho bordered Maizuru City to the north, Ayabe City to the east, and Fukuchiyama City to the west.
Oe-cho bordered Maizuru City to the north, Ayabe City to the east, and Fukuchiyama City to the west.

sen.j: もともとは同じ加佐郡あり、丹後田辺藩・舞鶴県と属していた舞鶴との結びつきが強かったが、北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線などが開通し、今では福知山とのつながりが強い。
sen.e: The area of Oe-cho originally had close ties to Maizuru because they had both belonged to Tanabe Domain in Tango Province, Maizuru Prefecture, and then Kasa-gun; since the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway opened, however, the area has had closer ties to Fukuchiyama today.

The area of Oe-cho originally had close ties to Maizuru because they both belonged to the Tanabe Domain in Tango Province, Maizuru Prefecture, and then Kasa-gun; since the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway opened, however, the area now has closer ties to Fukuchiyama today.

The area of Oe-cho originally had close ties to Maizuru because they both belonged to the Tanabe Domain in Tango Province, Maizuru Prefecture, and then Kasa-gun; since the Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway opened, however, the area now has closer ties to Fukuchiyama today.

sen.j: 町内を由良川が流れ、町のシンボルとして鬼伝説もある大江山がそびえる。
sen.e: The Yura-gawa River runs through the area, and the Oe-yama mountain range, a symbol of the town with the legend of an ogre, sits on it.
The Yura-gawa River runs through the area, and the Oe-yama mountain range, a symbol of the town with the legend of an ogre, sits on it.
The Yura-gawa River runs through the area, and the Oe-yama mountain range, a symbol of the town with the legend of an ogre, sits on it.
To the west and south: Fukuchiyama City
To the west and south: Fukuchiyama City
To the west and south: Fukuchiyama City

sen.j: 北－舞鶴市、宮津市、与謝郡加悦町
sen.e: To the north: Maizuru City, Miyazu City, and Kaya-cho in Yosa-gun
To the north: Maizuru City, Miyazu City, and Kaya-cho in Yosa-gun
To the north: Maizuru City, Miyazu City, and Kaya-cho in Yosa-gun

sen.j: 4月1日 河守上村、有路上村、有路下村、河東村、河西村の5村が、河守町に編入のうえ、大江町に改称
sen.e: On April 1, Komori-cho absorbed the five villages of Komorikami-mura, Arijikami-mura, Arijishimo-mura, Kawahigashi-mura and Kawanishi-mura, and changed its name to Oe-cho.
On April 1, Komori-cho absorbed the five villages of Komorikami-mura, Arijikami-mura, Arijishimo-mura, Kawahigashi-mura and Kawanishi-mura, and changed its name to Oe-cho.
On April 1, Komori-cho absorbed the five villages of Komorikami-mura, Arijikami-mura, Arijishimo-mura, Kawahigashi-mura and Kawanishi-mura, and changed its name to Oe-cho.

sen.j: 1月1日 天田郡の三和町、夜久野町とともに、福知山市に編入合併。
sen.e: On January 1, Oe-cho as well as Miwa-cho and Yakuno-cho in Amata-gun was absorbed by Fukuchiyama City.
On January 1, Oe-cho as well as Miwa-cho and Yakuno-cho in Amata-gun was absorbed by Fukuchiyama City.
On January 1, Oe-cho as well as Miwa-cho and Yakuno-cho in Amata-gun were absorbed by Fukuchiyama City.
The name of the new city remained Fukuchiyama City.
The name of the new city remained Fukuchiyama City.

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線：公庄駅 - 大江駅 (京都府) - 大江高校前駅 - 二俣駅 - 大江山口内宮駅
sen.e: Miyafuku Line: Gujo Station, Oe Station, Oe-kokomae Station, Futamata Station, and Oe-yamaguchi-naiku Station
sen.cmt: 原文には、「北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線」 とありますが、「北近畿タンゴ鉄道」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「宮福線」だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。原文には、「大江駅 (京都府)」 とありますが、「(京都府)」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「大江駅」だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。
sen.e: Miyafuku Line: Gujo Station, Oe Station, Oe-kokomae Station, Futamata Station, and Oe-yamaguchi-naiku Station
Miyafuku Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway: Gujo Station - Oe Station - Oe-kokomae Station - Futamata Station - Oe-yamaguchi-naiku Station
sen.cmt: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道 を追加しました。表記を統一しました。

sen.j: 中心となっていた駅：大江駅 (京都府)
かつて福知山駅と町中心部の河守とを北丹鉄道が結んでいたが、1971年3月2日休止を経て1974年2月28日で正式に廃止となった。
sen.e: The Hokutan Railway, which connected Fukuchiyama Station and the center of the town, Komori, halted its operation on March 2, 1971, and officially closed down on February 28, 1974.
The Hokutan Railway, which connected Fukuchiyama Station and the center of the town, Komori, halted its operation on March 2, 1971, and officially closed down on February 28, 1974.
The Hokutan Railway, which connected Fukuchiyama Station and the center of the town, Komori, halted its operation on March 2, 1971, and officially closed down on February 28, 1974.

sen.j: 現在の宮福線は、北丹鉄道ルートのやや西寄りを直線的に結んでいる。
sen.e: The Miyafuku Line presently runs straight a little to the west of the Kitakinki Tango Railway route.
The Miyafuku Line presently runs straight a little to the west of the Kitakinki Tango Railway route.

sen.j: 棚田日本の棚田百選一覧に選ばれた「毛原の棚田」では、毎年「棚田農業体験ツアー」や「棚田オーナー制度」を設けていた。
sen.e: As for the 'tanada (terraced paddy field) in Kehara,' which was selected as one of the Top 100 Terraced Paddy Fields in Japan, Oe-cho had set up the 'tanada farming tour' and the 'ownership system for the tanada.'
sen.cmt: 原文には、「棚田日本」 とありますが、「棚田」はリンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「日本」だけとなっており、本来はこちらの用語だけを使用していると思われますので、こちらだけを訳出しました。
sen.e: As for the 'tanada (terraced paddy field) in Kehara,' which was selected as one of the Top 100 Terraced Paddy Fields in Japan, Oe-cho had set up the 'tanada farming tour' and the 'ownership system for the tanada.'
